==I) Obliterative arteriopathy of the lower limbs===

*[[File:Atheroma.jpg|vignette]]'''Definition:'''  Obliterative arterial disease of the lower limbs (AOMI) is defined as the '''presence of atherosclerotic lesions in the aorta and underlying arteries perfusing the lower limbs''. It can lead to plaques (atheromatous plaque), stenosis or atheromatous obstructions of one or more arteries serving the pelvis and lower limbs.

*'''Frequency:'''' The prevalence of the disease increases with age, reaching more than '''20% over the age of 70.  '''

question.title: What is the definition of Obliterative Arterial Disease of the Lower Limbs (AOMI)?
question.description: Obliterative arterial disease of the lower limbs (AOMI) is defined as the presence of atherosclerotic lesions in the aorta and underlying arteries perfusing the lower limbs.

option_a.title: The presence of atherosclerotic lesions in the lower limbs and arteries serving the upper body
option_a.description: A plausible but incorrect definition of AOMI

option_b.title: The presence of atherosclerotic lesions in the aorta and underlying arteries perfusing the lower limbs

option_c.title: The presence of atherosclerotic lesions in the lower limbs and arteries serving the pelvis
option_c.description: A partially correct but incorrect definition of AOMI

option_d.title: The presence of atherosclerotic lesions in the upper body and arteries serving the lower limbs
option_d.description: A completely incorrect definition of AOMI

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
